name: Opal Champion
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 Knight creature with first strike.

name: Opalescence
text: Each other non-Aura enchantment is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

name: Opal-Eye, Konda's Yojimbo
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is dealt to Opal-Eye, Konda's Yojimbo instead.
{1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Opal-Eye this turn.

name: Opal Gargoyle
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Gargoyle is an enchantment, Opal Gargoyle becomes a 2/2 Gargoyle creature with flying.

name: Opal Guardian
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Guardian is an enchantment, Opal Guardian becomes a 3/4 Gargoyle creature with flying and protection from red.

editions.flavor: It was a moment in time, cast in stone—a moment whose time had come again.

name: Opaline Bracers
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Equipped creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of charge counters on Opaline Bracers.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Opaline Sliver
text: All Slivers have "Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell an opponent controls, you may draw a card."

editions.flavor:
"When struck, its hide shimmers through sequences of color—a signaling language I am eager to unravel."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Opaline Unicorn
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Purphoros once loved Nylea, the god of the hunt. His passion inspired his most astounding works of art.
Purphoros once loved Nylea, the god of the hunt. His passion inspired his most astounding works of art.

name: Opal Lake Gatekeepers
text: When Opal Lake Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: Sentries guard Ravnica's landmarks and outlying districts, unaware of these places' import to the maze.

name: Opal Palace
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. If you spend this mana to cast your commander, it enters the battlefield with a number of additional +1/+1 counters on it equal to the number of times it's been cast from the command zone this game.

name: Opal Titan
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Titan is an enchantment, Opal Titan becomes a 4/4 Giant creature with protection from each of that spell's colors.

name: Open the Armory
text: Search your library for an Aura or Equipment card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "Once Avacyn returned, I hoped I'd never need these things again. I didn't think I'd be dusting them off to use against angels."

name: Open the Vaults
text: Return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to the battlefield under their owners' control. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in graveyards.)

editions.flavor: When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.
When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.
When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.

name: Ophidian
text: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I will ... tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."
—Christopher Marlowe, Doctor Faustus

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Ophidian Eye
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

name: Ophiomancer
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if you control no Snakes, create a 1/1 black Snake creature token with deathtouch.

editions.flavor:
"There are dark, ancient arts that fascinate even me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Opportunist
text: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

editions.flavor: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.

name: Opportunity
text: Target player draws four cards.

editions.flavor:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard
"Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."

Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed
"Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."

"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Opposition
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

"Urza says he's sane. Perhaps, but measures of sanity among planeswalkers are hard to come by."
—Barrin

name: Oppression
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

"Do not presume to speak for yourself."
—Gix, to Xantcha

name: Oppressive Rays
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {3}.
Activated abilities of enchanted creature cost {3} more to activate.

name: Oppressive Will
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.

name: Opt
text:
Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "We need alternatives, Hanna," yelled Gerrard. "Now"

name: Opulent Palace
text:
Opulent Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}, {G}, or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The dense jungle surrenders to a lush and lavish expanse. At its center uncoil the spires of Qarsi Palace.
The dense jungle surrenders to a lush and lavish expanse. At its center uncoil the spires of Qarsi Palace.

name: Oracle
text: {0}: Untap target attacking creature you control and remove it from combat.

editions.flavor: Known simply by her title, Oracle uses her gift of prophecy to aid her people. She believes Gerrard to be the Korvecdal, the one who will unite the people of Rath against Volrath's tyranny. Her only doubt is whether she will be strong enough to guide him to his destiny.

name: Oracle en-Vec
text: {T}: Target opponent chooses any number of creatures he or she controls. During that player's next turn, the chosen creatures attack if able, and other creatures can't attack. At the beginning of that turn's end step, destroy each of the chosen creatures that didn't attack. Activate this ability only during your turn.

name: Oracle of Bones
text:
Haste
Tribute 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place two +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Oracle of Bones enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you may cast an instant or sorcery card from your hand without paying its mana cost.

name: Oracle of Dust
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{2}, Put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard: Draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: Whatever it is searching for, it will stop at nothing to find it.

name: Oracle of Mul Daya
text:
You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library if it's a land card.

name: Oracle of Nectars
text: {X}, {T}: You gain X life.

editions.flavor: When elves find a fount of beauty, they protect it. Where there is beauty, there is hope.

name: Oracle's Attendants
text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.

editions.flavor: They follow the prophecy to each new prophet, guarding the future from the present.
The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.
The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.

name: Oracle's Insight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Scry 1, then draw a card." (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Oran-Rief Hydra
text:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Oran-Rief Hydra. If that land is a Forest, put two +1/+1 counters on Oran-Rief Hydra instead.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

name: Oran-Rief Invoker
text: {8}: Oran-Rief Invoker gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor:
"The world was not hostile to us—we were beneath its notice, and presented no danger."
—The Invokers' Tales
"The world was not hostile to us—we were beneath its notice, and presented no danger."—The Invokers' Tales

name: Oran-Rief Recluse
text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
When Oran-Rief Recluse enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target creature with flying.

name: Oran-Rief Survivalist
text: Whenever Oran-Rief Survivalist or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Oran-Rief Survivalist.

editions.flavor: "I'm strong enough to survive alone. I'm smart enough to want companions at my side."

name: Oran-Rief, the Vastwood
text:
Oran-Rief, the Vastwood enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each green creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

name: Orator of Ojutai
text:
As an additional cost to cast Orator of Ojutai, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.
Defender, flying
When Orator of Ojutai enters the battlefield, if you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast Orator of Ojutai, draw a card.

name: Oraxid
text: Protection from red

editions.flavor:
"I'm constantly amazed by the tenacity of living creatures on this plane. Even in the stronghold's white-hot core, life persists."
—Ertai

name: Orb of Dreams
text: Permanents enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:
"Behind the eyelids, a flickering flame.
Beneath the dream, a flickering sorrow.
Can peace find you in this sleep
When all the world is tossed by war?"
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Orbs of Warding
text:
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
If a creature would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

editions.flavor: One orb to guard the body, one to protect the mind, and one to shield the soul.

name: Orbweaver Kumo
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Orbweaver Kumo gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

name: Orc General
text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph." —Malga Phlegmtooth

"Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."
—Malga Phlegmtooth

name: Orchard Elemental
text: Council's dilemma — When Orchard Elemental enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for sprout or harvest. Put two +1/+1 counters on Orchard Elemental for each sprout vote. You gain 3 life for each harvest vote.

editions.flavor: Fruits for friends, fists for foes.

name: Orchard Spirit
text: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.

editions.flavor: "Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

name: Orchard Warden
text: Whenever another Treefolk creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: "After the Rising, a treefolk's mind is as limber and green as its limbs, and is at its most receptive to our teachings."

name: Orcish Artillery
text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

editions.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog

text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Orcish Bloodpainter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Blood calls to blood.

name: Orcish Cannonade
text:
Orcish Cannonade deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Crispy! Scarback! Load another volcano-ball."
—Stumphobbler Thuj, orcish captain

—Stumphobbler Thuj, Orcish captain

name: Orcish Cannoneers
text: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

editions.flavor:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Orcish Captain
text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: There's a chance to win every battle.
There's a chance to win every battle.
There's a chance to win every battle.

name: Orcish Conscripts
text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

name: Orcish Farmer
text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming.

"Yes, the farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

"Yes, the Farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

name: Orcish Healer
text:
{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
{B}{B}{R}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.
{R}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.

name: Orcish Librarian
text: {R}, {T}: Look at the top eight cards of your library. Exile four of them at random, then put the rest on top of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: "Us hungry, need food . . . . Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . ."

Us hungry, need food . . . .
Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . .

name: Orcish Lumberjack
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Wood is wasted in the dirt."
—Orcish proverb

"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

—Orcish proverb

"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

name: Orcish Mechanics
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Orcish Mechanics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Orcish Mine
text:
Enchant land
Orcish Mine enters the battlefield with three ore counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, remove an ore counter from Orcish Mine.
When the last ore counter is removed from Orcish Mine, destroy enchanted land and Orcish Mine deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Orcish Oriflamme
text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

editions.flavor: The orcs' banner sends a clear message: "Stand against us and meet the same fate as the goblins."

name: Orcish Paratroopers
text: When Orcish Paratroopers comes into play, flip it from a height of at least one foot. Sacrifice Orcish Paratroopers unless it lands face up after turning over completely.

editions.flavor:
IOU one parashoot
—Urk, mogg fanatic

name: Orcish Settlers
text: {X}{X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Orcish Settlers: Destroy X target lands.

editions.flavor: They wouldn't know their house from a charred hole in the ground.

name: Orcish Spy
text: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.

editions.flavor:
"Orcish armies often employed the smaller, swifter, and less intelligent Goblins as spies."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

"Yeah, they're ugly, they desert in droves, and their personal habits are enough to make you sick. But I'll say this for Orcs: they make great spies."
—Ivra Jursdotter

"You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the Orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight"
—General Khurzog

"You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight"
—General Khurzog

name: Orcish Squatters
text: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.

name: Orcish Squatters Avatar
text: At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {C} to your mana pool for each land target opponent controls.

editions.flavor: ME2 Participation Avatar

name: Orcish Veteran
text:
Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.
Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the Orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.
Although models of courage for Orcs, the Veterans quickly learned to fear the swift justice of their Icatian enemies.

"Orcs often greeted promotions to Icatian battle with anguished wails and pleas for mercy."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI
Orcs are not exactly known for their valor—although most Orcs have seen countless battles, only a handful have actually fought in them.

name: Orc Sureshot
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Words have yet to halt an arrow."

name: Ordeal of Erebos
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Erebos.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Erebos, target player discards two cards.

name: Ordeal of Heliod
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Heliod.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Heliod, you gain 10 life.

name: Ordeal of Nylea
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Nylea.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Nylea, search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

name: Ordeal of Purphoros
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

name: Ordeal of Thassa
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Thassa.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Thassa, draw two cards.

name: Order
text: Exile target attacking creature.

name: Ordered Migration
text: Domain — Create a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: "Birds reach all parts of the world," said Barrin. "They will make excellent scouts."

name: Order of Leitbur
text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with orcish and goblin raiders."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

"The powers of the corrupt will fade before the fury of the pure."
—Bethan Leitbur, "The Way"
Followers of Tourach regarded all other religions equally: with open contempt. Not so the followers of Leitbur, who made it their mission to eradicate the Order of the Ebon Hand.

"Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with Orcish and Goblin raiders."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

name: Order of Succession
text: Choose left or right. Starting with you and proceeding in the chosen direction, each player chooses a creature controlled by the next player in that direction. Each player gains control of the creature he or she chose.

editions.flavor: "Long live . . . me."

name: Order of the Ebon Hand
text:
Protection from white
{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"There are intriguing similarities between the Order and Icatia's Leitbur religion, suggesting the two had a common origin."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI
A true follower of Tourach took pride in achievement to the exclusion of other concerns.
Dedicated to the principles of Tourach, members of the Order of the Ebon Hand demonstrated their devotion with grisly rituals.

name: Order of the Golden Cricket
text: Whenever Order of the Golden Cricket attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, it gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Should you take it in mind to ride a springjack, remember: there are easier ways to fly, and harder ways to break your skull."
—Lann of Cloverdell
"My brother, it may now be time to ring the bell and put out the call for aid."
"Our bodies are weak compared to those of the kami, our knowledge limited, and our magic poor. Yet we draw breath. That alone is reason to hope."

name: Order of the Sacred Torch
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.

editions.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.
A blazing light to drive out the shadows.
A blazing light to drive out the shadows.

name: Order of the Stars
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
As Order of the Stars enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Order of the Stars has protection from the chosen color.

editions.flavor: As stoic as the marble halls, as unblinking as the stars upon their shields.

name: Order of the White Shield
text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A shield of light admits no shadow.

"Shall we turn away a worthy soul because his parents were peasants? I think not."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield
A shield of light admits no shadow.

"Shall we turn away a worthy soul because his parents were peasants? I think not."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Order of Whiteclay
text: {1}{W}{W}, {Q}: Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Made from the clay of burial mounds, the face paint of the priests is a sign of their respect for those whose rest they interrupt.

name: Order of Yawgmoth
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Order of Yawgmoth deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Ordruun Commando
text: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.

editions.flavor: Thick of muscle, stout of heart, and possessing a burning love of justice and the battlefield, the Ordruun minotaurs are the foundation of the Boros Legion.

name: Ordruun Veteran
text: Battalion — Whenever Ordruun Veteran and at least two other creatures attack, Ordruun Veteran gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

editions.flavor: "My father was Gruul, but I chose the precision of the legion over the fury of the pack."

name: Ore Gorger
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may destroy target nonbasic land.

editions.flavor:
"We've stumbled upon a network of caves not on our maps. We can only hope it is safe to spend the night."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno

name: Oreskos Explorer
text: When Oreskos Explorer enters the battlefield, search your library for up to X Plains cards, where X is the number of players who control more lands than you. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

name: Oreskos Sun Guide
text: Inspired — Whenever Oreskos Sun Guide becomes untapped, you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Let the humans have their pantheon. We need no gods to thrive. Even a mortal such as I can capture a part of the sun's power."

After the Battle of Pharagax Bridge, the Champion spent many months among the leonin of Oreskos. She found that they were quick to take offense, not because they were thin-skinned, but because they were always eager for a fight.
—The Theriad

After the Battle of Pharagax Bridge, the Champion spent many months among the leonin of Oreskos. She found that they were quick to take offense, not because they were thin-skinned, but because they were always eager for a fight.
—The Theriad

name: Organ Grinder
text: {T}, Exile three cards from your graveyard: Target player loses 3 life.

editions.flavor: It knows what makes you tick. It knows how to make the ticking stop.

name: Organ Harvest
text: You and your teammates may sacrifice any number of creatures. For each creature sacrificed in this way, add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Lucy, you've got some spleenin' to do."

name: Orgg
text:
Trample
Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.

editions.flavor: It's bigger than it thinks.
It's bigger than it thinks.
It's bigger than it thinks.

name: Origin Spellbomb
text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Origin Spellbomb: Create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.
When Origin Spellbomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {W}. If you do, draw a card.

name: Orim
text: Creatures you control have reach.

editions.flavor: Trained in the Samite arts, Orim serves as the healer aboard the Weatherlight. She is quick with languages and was educated at the same Argivian university as Hanna. A student by nature, Orim keeps a diary of all her new discoveries—both physical and spiritual—during her travels.

name: Orim, Samite Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor:
"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer

"The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Orim's Chant
text:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)
Target player can't cast spells this turn.
If Orim's Chant was kicked, creatures can't attack this turn.

name: Orim's Cure
text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Orim's Cure's mana cost.
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Orim's Prayer
text: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, you gain 1 life for each attacking creature.

editions.flavor:
"As usual, there will be time for prayer only after the worst happens."
—Orim, Samite healer

name: Orim's Thunder
text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If Orim's Thunder was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to target creature.

name: Orim's Touch
text:
Kicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} as you cast this spell.)
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. If Orim's Touch was kicked, prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to that creature or player this turn instead.
